snippet: The Lebanese militant group said the drone, which was shot down by Israeli forces, had been designed in Iran and assembled by Hezbollah experts in Lebanon.
abstract: Hassan Nasrallah, leader of the Lebanese militant group and political party Hezbollah, declares that his fighters had assembled and piloted drone that flew 35 miles into Israel; calls flight unprecedented achievement for the resistance, and claims drone was designed in Iran.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Hania Mourtada and Hwaida Saad from Beirut, and Isabel Kershner and Jodi Rudoren from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: The Lebanese militant group said the drone, which was shot down by Israeli forces, had been designed in Iran and assembled by Hezbollah experts in Lebanon.

headline.seo: Hezbollah Flew Drone Into Israel, Its Leader Says
headline.main: Hezbollah Says It Flew Iranian-Designed Drone Into Israel
headline.print_headline: Hezbollah Says It Flew Drone Into Israel, and Describes Iran as Its Designer
